content.description: Start with a left foot low on a thin edge, then swing a big right foot up high.  From there, continue straight up using the ladder-like jug system.
content.protection: Pad and a spot, as there is a large rock directly behind the problem.
content.location: This is just east of the northeast arete.

content.description: Climb the middle-left section of the north face of Broken Boulder.
content.location: You can downclimb on the west side of the boulder.

content.description: Climb the arete on the north west side of Broken Boulder.
content.location: You can downclimb on the west side of the boulder.

content.description:
Sit start with your right hand on the arete and your Â left hand incut edge. From there, ascend the slab by compressing edges on the face, match hands on an edge, gain the jug relief before the lip, then stab the lip, and mantel atop the boulder.

Most of the difficulty here comes from whether or not you can reach past the smaller left hand edges to better holds near the boulder's downclimb. With my dimensions, these holds were not an option, but if you have a wide reach, this may require an eliminate spirit.
content.protection: A pair of pads, the landing is perfect.
content.location: It climbs the boulder's west facing slab, just south of the boulder's down climb.

content.description: Start at a crimp with the left hand and sidepull with the right. I put a foot up really high to the right and just pushed up to another great sidepull on the right. From there, you're basically at the top.

Climb the center of the south face of Broken Boulder. There are good holds, but the crux seemed to be the top out. It's not a flat top but a sloping ramp upward, so you're still working as you move upward.
content.location: It is right in the center of south face of the Broken Boulder. The downclimb is on the north west side.

content.description: Using the arete's crimps and awkward footing (watch your knee on this one), climb straight up to good holds that allow for a clean finish.
content.protection: Pad, good landing for this problem though.
content.location: This ascends the northeast arete of the boulder.
